extendedIngredients.name: chicken breasts
extendedIngredients.original: 2 large chicken breasts, about 1 pound 4 oz.
extendedIngredients.originalString: 2 large chicken breasts, about 1 pound 4 oz.

extendedIngredients.name: fresh mixed herbs
extendedIngredients.original: 2 tablespoons chopped mixed fresh herbs, such as sage, parsley, thyme and/or chives, divided
extendedIngredients.originalString: 2 tablespoons chopped mixed fresh herbs, such as sage, parsley, thyme and/or chives, divided
extendedIngredients.originalName: chopped mixed fresh herbs, such as sage, parsley, thyme and/or chives, divided

title: chicken and biscuits casserole
instructions: Place chicken breast in a medium saucepan and cover completely with cold tap water. Place over high heat and bring to a simmer. Reduce heat to maintain a gentle simmer and cook, turning in the poaching liquid occasionally until the chicken is no longer pink in the center and cooked through, 15 to 18 minutes, depending on thickness of the meat. Remove the chicken and let cool. Cut chicken into cubes. Preheat oven to 400 degrees F. Coat a 9 by 13-inch baking dish with cooking spray. Heat 2 tablespoons oil in a large saucepan over medium heat.  Add onion, carrots, celery, garlic, 3/4 teaspoon salt and pepper and cook, stirring occasionally until the vegetables are softened and starting to brown, 10 to 12 minutes. Sprinkle 1/4 cup all-purpose flour over the vegetable mixture and stir to coat. Add broth and bring to a boil, stirring often. Stir in the chicken, peas and 1 tablespoon plus 1 teaspoon herbs and return to a simmer, stirring often. Transfer the chicken mixture to the prepared baking dish. Whisk the remaining 1 cup all-purpose flour, white-whole wheat flour, baking powder, baking soda and the remaining 1/4 teaspoon salt in a medium bowl.  Whisk egg, buttermilk, the remaining 1 tablespoon canola oil and the remaining 2 teaspoons herb mixture in a large bowl. Add the flour mixture into the buttermilk mixture and stir until a shaggy dough forms.  Drop by spoonfuls over the chicken mixture. Transfer to the oven and bake until the biscuits are puffed and golden and the sauce is bubbling, about 25 minutes.

steps.step: Place chicken breast in a medium saucepan and cover completely with cold tap water.

Place over high heat and bring to a simmer. Reduce heat to maintain a gentle simmer and cook, turning in the poaching liquid occasionally until the chicken is no longer pink in the center and cooked through, 15 to 18 minutes, depending on thickness of the meat.
Remove the chicken and let cool.
Cut chicken into cubes. Preheat oven to 400 degrees F. Coat a 9 by 13-inch baking dish with cooking spray.
Heat 2 tablespoons oil in a large saucepan over medium heat.

Add onion, carrots, celery, garlic, 3/4 teaspoon salt and pepper and cook, stirring occasionally until the vegetables are softened and starting to brown, 10 to 12 minutes. Sprinkle 1/4 cup all-purpose flour over the vegetable mixture and stir to coat.
Add broth and bring to a boil, stirring often. Stir in the chicken, peas and 1 tablespoon plus 1 teaspoon herbs and return to a simmer, stirring often.
Transfer the chicken mixture to the prepared baking dish.
Whisk the remaining 1 cup all-purpose flour, white-whole wheat flour, baking powder, baking soda and the remaining 1/4 teaspoon salt in a medium bowl.
Whisk egg, buttermilk, the remaining 1 tablespoon canola oil and the remaining 2 teaspoons herb mixture in a large bowl.
Add the flour mixture into the buttermilk mixture and stir until a shaggy dough forms.  Drop by spoonfuls over the chicken mixture.
Transfer to the oven and bake until the biscuits are puffed and golden and the sauce is bubbling, about 25 minutes.
